title: Downloading
---


h2(#github). Source on github

ScalaSTM is hosted at ["github.com/nbronson/scala-stm":http://github.com/nbronson/scala-stm].  If you system has "git":http://git-scm.com/, the best way to get the source code is to clone this repository.

{% highlight bash %}
git clone https://github.com/nbronson/scala-stm.git
{% endhighlight %}

"tar.gz":https://github.com/nbronson/scala-stm/tarball/master and "zip":https://github.com/nbronson/scala-stm/zipball/master source bundles are also available.  These are automatically generated from the current state of the master branch.

Building and testing is done with ["sbt":http://code.google.com/p/simple-build-tool/]:
# Download the dependencies (currently just @scala@ and @scalatest@)
{% highlight bash %}
sbt update
{% endhighlight %}
# Compile everything and run the tests
{% highlight bash %}
sbt test
{% endhighlight %}
# Build a JAR file
{% highlight bash %}
sbt package
{% endhighlight %}
